newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia changes listing rules to boost liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia changes listing rules to boost liquidity.

text.p: Malaysia's securities watchdog said on Tuesday it was revising guidelines for companies listing on the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange (KLSE) to boost liquidity on the local bourse.

"The upward revisions in the minimum issued and paid-up capital for a Main Board listing and the maximum issued and paid-up capital for a Second board listing have been made with the objective of increasing the free float and hence liquidity of shares listed on the KLSE, especially on the Second Board," the Securities Commission said in a statement.
